definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

sentences.english: Today the opening of a new house, all predecessors of the exhibitions…
sentences.chinese: 今天小屋新开张，请各位前辈们多多指教了。

sentences.english: Plesae help with the bird ids, thanks.
And I will teach you the way that is good and right.
sentences.chinese: 我必以善道正路指教你们。

sentences.english: I am the way Jing Jing, first meeting, please exhibitions.
sentences.chinese: 我是程婧婧，初次见面，请多多指教。

sentences.english: He gave me his counsel in the matter.
sentences.chinese: 关于那件事，他给了我一些指教。

sentences.english: Some tension, and got bit wrong.
sentences.chinese: 难免紧张出错，多多包涵与指教。

sentences.english: Thank you for your comments and directions.
Finally, thanks for your review and comment.
sentences.chinese: 最后由衷感谢您的评论与指教。

sentences.english: A:United Airlines reservation desk,Mrs.Carson.May I help you?
sentences.chinese: 联合航空公司预订台的卡逊太太，您有什么指教吗？

sentences.english: Wise men seek instruction; fools fall for applause.
sentences.chinese: 聪明人找人指教，蠢人则在赞美声中跌倒。

sentences.english: Then will I teach transgressors thy ways; and sinners shall be converted unto thee.
sentences.chinese: 我必将你的道路指教有过犯的人，罪人必回转归向你。

sentences.english: OK, I'm all yours now. What's up?
sentences.chinese: 好了，现在可以悉听指教了。什么事？

sentences.english: If you think my Chinese sucks please also teach me.
sentences.chinese: 如果您觉得我中文太烂我也会虚心听您指教。

sentences.english: I enjoyed the great benefit of his instructions concerning the matter.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上他的指教使我受益匪浅。

sentences.english: All circles are welcomed to instruct the works of the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 展出期间欢迎各界同好莅临指教。

definition: lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
I have been enlightened by your teaching (humble)
to point out/to indicate/to give directions/to show how (to do sth)/to censure/to pick at
brother (polite appellation for a friend one's age)
to come with a specific purpose in mind
